item.title: Customs null - dwarf remains :'(
item.dc:creator: @wboar wboar
item.description:
@wboar wrote:

Rename your model files to 101 and 102
101 is drop model and 102 is wield model.
If im right Model called “Barek Godsword” is wield model so rename it to 102 and model called “Barek Godswordb” is drop model so rename it 101

Here you can see item drop model

class8.anInt174 = 101;

and this is wield model

class8.anInt165 = 102; class8.anInt200 = 102;

Read full topic

item.title: Customs null - dwarf remains :'(
item.dc:creator: @stickywicky stickywicky
item.description:
@stickywicky wrote:

right…
i know thiers a section for client model help but it doesnt get many views so ill ask here

right my problem is
i was following this guide : http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_SK-pM-IE00
and he says to add models into your models folder…(ovo) so i do for example
im putting
barok godsword and admin godsword
so this is them in my models folder

and then he says to add it into class8.java …
so i do

if(i == 14492){ class8.aString170 = "Barek Godsword" class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear"; class8.anIntArray156 = new int[1]; class8.anIntArray160 = new int[1]; class8.anInt174 = 101; class8.anInt181 = 1957; class8.anInt190 = 498; class8.anInt198 = 484; class8.anInt204 = 0; class8.anInt169 = -1; class8.anInt194 = -1; class8.anInt165 = 102; class8.anInt200 = 102; class8.anInt175 = -1; class8.anInt197 = -1; class8.aString170 = "Barek Godsword"; class8.aByteArray178 = "A Godsword made by one of the greatest crafters.".getBytes(); }

then the guy goes into his char file…puts the code to equipt on his head then he launches server ect… (obviusly compiles before) and his client too
then he has the bandos kiteshield (the item he used)
i did egsactly the same but mine came up with dwarf remains…ive tried this with a number of things…

so if any 1 can fix this problem their a hero

offtopic-

now if it helpes the owner said it was “client sided” when some 1 wanted to change the name of the bank message
